subtitles.text: Hello everyone. My name is Harukawa Koizumi, aka Oharu.
Yes, so today.
I answered one, oh, oh, 100 questions!
This is a project that I've been getting requests for.
I'm going to answer 100 questions!
I have never answered 100 questions before!
So this is going to be a little bit long video.
I hope you all enjoy it!
Well, I have recruited on Instagram!
Thank you!
Now, I'd like to answer them right away!
I'll just go ahead and poof!
Wow! Wow, we got 5,000!
5000 for 100 questions!
Thank you!
Well, I'll answer a few excerpts!
I'll try to make it clear, you know.
I feel like I should write something positive or something.
I feel like I'm in trouble.
Positive letters are very primitive.
It's a little bit old-fashioned.
I'll get some paper, paper.
I have to write it down.
I don't know how many I've counted.
Whenever I select a question box, I always carefully select from the beginning.
I'm always very selective from the beginning.
But this time, I didn't have much time.
I'm going to answer a hundred questions.
I will answer 100 questions.
Okay, here we go!
Oharu, what is your favorite part of your makeup?What is Oharu-chan's speciality in makeup?
This is the first one.
Oharu-chan's makeup obsession
Recently, I try to use slightly darker eye shadow.
I like mature makeup.
Here's what I'm doing today.
A little bit around the eyes.
Dusky pink eyeshadow?
I like to use eye shadow like this.
I like to use dark eye shadow.
I like to use dark eye shadow to give a mature impression.
I like to use it to give a mature impression.
This kind of color eye shadow.
I like to put this around the corner of the eyes.
But if that's all you do, it's a little too dark, so I like to use some kind of lame to cover it up.
I like to use some kind of lame to cover it up.
I also like to use a dark lip color like this.
I've also been using black mascara lately.
I also like to lighten my eyebrows by one or two tones.
As for my eyebrows...
I learned this from an eyebrow make-up artist.
Visee Instant Eyebrow Color No. BR2. I love this color because it's so cute!
I also use Lilimu's In the Mirror Eye Palette No. 03 Winter Gray as eyeshadow.
I like to use a color that looks like a glaze.
I like to use a color that looks a little bit like a glaze, but it's not too harsh.
I like to use a color that's a bit harsh.
But the lam√© can make it look a little fake.
I'm into mature and cute makeup.
Thank you very much for your question. Thanks for the question.
Let's continue.
What is your favorite thing about Julia?Can you tell me what you like about Julia?
Of course I do.
What I like about you, Julia...
Her graceful dance moves.
And the way she moves forward and backward.
And also...
Since Haru and Julia performed together on stage, they started talking seriously about their work.
I wonder if there are things that she tells only to me.
Julia often complimented me on my singing. She often asked me how I could hit the high notes.
She often compliments me on my singing.
I'm a person who likes singing a lot.
I'm very happy when Julia praises my singing.
Like, when she listens to me sing.
Also...
Bangs? There are a lot of things I really like about her, like her bangs... and her dryness... and her dryness.
There are a lot of things I really like about him. Next year, I hope we can go out for dinner again.
Third one...
Third, have you read the DM? I do! I read all your DMs and replies to your stories, so I read all your mentions when I can.
If I have time, I check the mentions on my instagram.
I'm sorry, but since the latter half of December, I can't open my instagram outside the house because of the communication limitation.
So I don't update my Insta as much as I used to, but I have Wi-Fi at home, so when I have Wi-Fi, I look at it.
I'm the kind of person who looks for Wi-Fi all the time, so lately I've become a Wi-Fi addict.
How's your strength training going? I've been slacking off on my strength training lately.
I'm going to find out how many positive numbers I need to write to reach 100.
I'll find out how many positive letters it takes to make 100.
Why did you choose this picture for your Insta icon? I think it's the one with the braids.
I used to have a different one, but it's just so tiny.
You can see everyone's icons like this, right? When you look at them, you see a bright face or something.
I thought it was cute to see a bright face or a face that looks like "Wow! I think that's why I chose that icon.
And then, do you like Eechi? I love Eech-chan. I worked with Eech-chan on a TV show called Music Globe the other night.
She's so cute and every time I see her, you know...She was incredibly cute, and every time, you know...
Whenever we took pictures, Ichi would ask if she could sit next to me and take a picture with me, and she was so cute.
I hope I can go on a date with Eechi next year.
What was your most memorable concert in 2022?
Well, Makuhari Messe was one, but I was most impressed with Girls Land. I'm sure I've talked about Makuhari in various places.
This year, Girls Land was held at Zeppahaneda, and I was so happy that nearly 4,000 girls came to see us.
So I was really happy that there were so many more girls than at the previous Girls' Land.
The girls were so sparkly and pretty, and they came with lots of makeup and fashion.
Of course, the boys also cut their hair when they come to the show, and I think they are very particular about it.
I'm so happy that everyone does so many things before coming to see us.
I think Girls Land was a live that will go down in history, and I want to do my best to make the girls like us even more.
Are there any idols other than Studan that you are close with?
I personally really like Spaga, and I watch their music videos without fail.
I also like Katorena from AKB48.
She told me that she also watches my YouTube channel, so I really hope we can have a dinner sometime.
I'd be really happy if we could have dinner sometime.
Please take a look.
What is your favorite hairstyle of a girl?
I'm going to the next concert with that haircut!
I like the half-twin hairstyle that Hiyori wore on Jikketsu because it's so cute!
I think the half-twin is really cute and blends in with the hair that's down.
Is there a song you want to play on the guitar now?
I'd like to play Kaleido Proud Festa by Unison Sky Garden.
This song has a lot of chords that are great for practicing on the guitar, and it's a great song to practice on.
It's a great song to practice while playing.
Also, "Tokise no Star" is also a good practice song.
Next year, I'd like to show some of Oharu's guitar practice.
I'm a total beginner, so I can't do it...
Yes, Kaleidoproud Festa and Star are good songs to practice.
If you could change the color of the members, what would it be?
I usually play warm colors, so...I usually work with warm colors.
I like to wear green or something like this in my clothes, and I don't mean to be rude to Hiyori, but I like to wear darker colors.
I like to wear darker colors because they give me a sense of restraint.
So I'd like to wear green or blue, not pastels.
I always want to wear blue when I wear kimono.
I'd like to wear purple and other cool colors.

But lately I've been wearing my favorites.

I see.

After Hiyori and Aki-chan sang the chorus, I said, "Will I see you again?
Then Julia sang the 3rd chorus.
I thought it was one of the live videos of that July Cider concert.
I thought it was one of those live performances.
What kind of ramen have you been into lately?
The ramen I've been into recently.
There's a Sapporo ramen restaurant called Kita no Daichi.
Sapporo Miso Ramen? Miso Butter Ramen was delicious!
It's pretty high on my list.
How often do you eat ramen?
I eat ramen about 6 times a week.
If I combine ramen, soba and udon...
I think I eat ramen about 7 or 8 times a week.
I eat standing-only buckwheat noodles and regular cup ramen, etc.
I think that's about how often I eat ramen.
What is ozoni like in the Koizumi household?
The Koizumi family's ozoni is rather light.Koizumi family's ozoni is rather light and simple.
It's just regular family zoni with daikon radish and carrots.
There's nothing special about the taste.
I think it's pretty light.
It doesn't have any miso in it or anything.
It doesn't have any miso or anything, and it's not too clear.
I think it's a rather orthodox ozoni.
You can put as much rice cake as you like.
I want to know the origin of the name.
The origin of the name?
Well, the origin of the name...
Originally, it was a name that would be given when spring was born.
It was either Haru or Haru or Haru or Haru as it is now.
I heard that it is better to be named Haru or Haru-ka than Haru or Haru-ka when you are born.
I heard that it was better to be named Haruka than Haru or Haru when I was born.
Is this the origin of the name?
If it's true... it smells like spring...
I hope that's the origin of the name.
I'm sorry, it's not what I expected.
I like the fringe, but do you plan to have it done?
I like bangs like this for now.
They're not see-through, but they're a little thinner.
I went to a hairdresser.
I think I like bangs like this because it's the most relaxed.

I want to know what made you decide to become an idol.
What made you decide to become an idol?
What made you decide to become an idol?
I don't know... I don't know...
I didn't have a clear reason.
It's not like I originally raised my hand, but...
It's not a raise of the hand, but...
Well...
We were looking for people who wanted to be in the group, and we held auditions.
Originally we were a group called Tokimeki Advertising Club, but we created a new group called Tokimeki Advertising Club, and we continued after that.
So I didn't start idolizing because I really wanted to be an idol or because I auditioned for it.
But I think it was a very good decision for me to become an idol.
If I had another life, if I had this chance to become an idol, I probably would have become an idol without hesitation.
I'm very glad that I'm here now even though I didn't have the chance to become an idol.
Yes, I am.
What is the one thing you can't lose to anyone?
I think I have a pretty good memory. I can remember the birthdays of everyone in STAPLER.
I can remember the birthdays of my family, friends, and relatives.
And then there is the mentality of steel.
Do you prefer Bolano or Apino? I prefer Apino.
What is the hardest song to dance to in the special selection? The hardest song is "hop step jump love" which we are currently performing as a new song.
The reason why it's the hardest is because the jump in that song doesn't have an auxiliary run.
hop step jump love is not a song where you prepare for each jump.
So each jump has a clear landing.
And the endless jumps are always tough.It was very strenuous and my muscles ached a lot.
If I were to go somewhere by myself, I would like to go to Ishikawa Prefecture.

and July Cider... and maybe a lot of sad songs like that.

What is a live concert like?
Well, I'm not able to do voice now.
I used to do a lot of live performances with my voice.
But now...
I don't know if it's really appropriate to say this, but...
But now, I'd like people to see me as if I were an artist performing live.
But we, the promoters, the fans, are called "promoters.
I think the charm of a live concert is the sense of unity with the fans and the promoters.
I can't get them to call out to me, but I can get a lot of applause and fenlight.
We can't get them to call out to us, but we can get them to cheer us on with applause and fenlight.
It's like a space where you can enjoy our songs together.
And what I think is the charm of a live concert?
The charm of music?
I think the charm of a live concert is to have everyone enjoy the music.
TOKISEN's music has a variety of songs.
There are so many variations of songs.
